com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class ButtonBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.VisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidViewComponent
        • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.ButtonBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    View.OnClickListener, View.OnFocusChangeListener, View.OnLongClickListener, View.OnTouchListener, Component
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Button, Picker

    public abstract class ButtonBase
extends AndroidViewComponent
implements View.OnClickListener, View.OnFocusChangeListener, View.OnLongClickListener, View.OnTouchListener
    Underlying base class for click-based components, not directly accessible to Simple programmers.

    • Method Detail

      • onTouch

        public boolean onTouch(View view,
              MotionEvent me)
        If a custom background images is specified for the button, then it will lose the pressed and disabled image effects; no visual feedback. The approach below is to provide a visual feedback if and only if an image is assigned to the button. In this situation, we overlay a gray background when pressed and release when not-pressed.
        Specified by:
        onTouch in interface View.OnTouchListener

      • getView

        public View getView()
        Description copied from class: AndroidViewComponent
        Returns the View that is displayed in the UI.
        Specified by:
        getView in class AndroidViewComponent

      • GotFocus

        public void GotFocus()
        Indicates the cursor moved over the button so it is now possible to click it.

      • LostFocus

        public void LostFocus()
        Indicates the cursor moved away from the button so it is now no longer possible to click it.

      • TextAlignment

        public int TextAlignment()
        Returns the alignment of the button's text: center, normal (e.g., left-justified if text is written left to right), or opposite (e.g., right-justified if text is written left to right).
        Returns:
        one of Component.ALIGNMENT_NORMAL, Component.ALIGNMENT_CENTER or Component.ALIGNMENT_OPPOSITE

      • TextAlignment

        public void TextAlignment(int alignment)
        Specifies the alignment of the button's text: center, normal (e.g., left-justified if text is written left to right), or opposite (e.g., right-justified if text is written left to right).
        Parameters:
        alignment - one of Component.ALIGNMENT_NORMAL, Component.ALIGNMENT_CENTER or Component.ALIGNMENT_OPPOSITE

      • Shape

        public int Shape()
        Returns the style of the button.
        Returns:
        one of Component.BUTTON_SHAPE_DEFAULT, Component.BUTTON_SHAPE_ROUNDED, Component.BUTTON_SHAPE_RECT or Component.BUTTON_SHAPE_OVAL

      • Shape

        public void Shape(int shape)
        Specifies the style the button. This does not check that the argument is a legal value.
        Parameters:
        shape - one of Component.BUTTON_SHAPE_DEFAULT, Component.BUTTON_SHAPE_ROUNDED, Component.BUTTON_SHAPE_RECT or Component.BUTTON_SHAPE_OVAL
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if shape is not a legal value.

      • Image

        public String Image()
        Returns the path of the button's image.
        Returns:
        the path of the button's image

      • Image

        public void Image(String path)
        Specifies the path of the button's image.

        See MediaUtil.determineMediaSource(com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Form, java.lang.String) for information about what a path can be.

        Parameters:
        path - the path of the button's image

      • BackgroundColor

        public int BackgroundColor()
        Returns the button's background color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer.
        Returns:
        background RGB color with alpha

      • BackgroundColor

        public void BackgroundColor(int argb)
        Specifies the button's background color as an alpha-red-green-blue integer. If the parameter is Component.COLOR_DEFAULT, the original beveling is restored. If an Image has been set, the color change will not be visible until the Image is removed.
        Parameters:
        argb - background RGB color with alpha

      • Enabled

        public boolean Enabled()
        Returns true if the button is active and clickable.
        Returns:
        true indicates enabled, false disabled

      • Enabled

        public void Enabled(boolean enabled)
        Specifies whether the button should be active and clickable.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true for enabled, false disabled

      • FontBold

        public boolean FontBold()
        Returns true if the button's text should be bold. If bold has been requested, this property will return true, even if the font does not support bold.
        Returns:
        true indicates bold, false normal

      • FontBold

        public void FontBold(boolean bold)
        Specifies whether the button's text should be bold. Some fonts do not support bold.
        Parameters:
        bold - true indicates bold, false normal

      • ShowFeedback

        public void ShowFeedback(boolean showFeedback)
        Specifies if a visual feedback should be shown when a button with an assigned image is pressed.
        Parameters:
        showFeedback - true enables showing feedback, false disables it

      • ShowFeedback

        public boolean ShowFeedback()
        Returns true if the button's text should be bold. If bold has been requested, this property will return true, even if the font does not support bold.
        Returns:
        true indicates visual feedback will be shown, false visual feedback will not be shown

      • FontItalic

        public boolean FontItalic()
        Returns true if the button's text should be italic. If italic has been requested, this property will return true, even if the font does not support italic.
        Returns:
        true indicates italic, false normal

      • FontItalic

        public void FontItalic(boolean italic)
        Specifies whether the button's text should be italic. Some fonts do not support italic.
        Parameters:
        italic - true indicates italic, false normal

      • FontSize

        public float FontSize()
        Returns the button's text's font size, measured in pixels.
        Returns:
        font size in pixel

      • FontSize

        public void FontSize(float size)
        Specifies the button's text's font size, measured in pixels.
        Parameters:
        size - font size in pixel

      • FontTypeface

        public int FontTypeface()
        Returns the button's text's font face as default, serif, sans serif, or monospace.
        Returns:
        one of Component.TYPEFACE_DEFAULT, Component.TYPEFACE_SERIF, Component.TYPEFACE_SANSSERIF or Component.TYPEFACE_MONOSPACE

      • FontTypeface

        public void FontTypeface(int typeface)
        Specifies the button's text's font face as default, serif, sans serif, or monospace.
        Parameters:
        typeface - one of Component.TYPEFACE_DEFAULT, Component.TYPEFACE_SERIF, Component.TYPEFACE_SANSSERIF or Component.TYPEFACE_MONOSPACE
